m_DescList: The game developer has a quirky demand: Now, immediately, count all English letters starting with 's', or he won't sleep tonight.
Uppercase matching symbols generally represent the complement set of their lowercase counterparts!
<color=#FF68DD>\z</color> matches only at end of string
<color=#FF68DD>\Z</color> matches at string end or before final newline
When input data contains trailing newlines, \z and \Z behave differently. Due to debugging headaches, these will not be tested in any game questions.
Now, the objective is to count all English letters starting with 's'.
In this test, the content to be matched has the following characteristics:
<color=#FF68DD>\A </color><color=#3173FF>\s</color>   Match starting with string beginning or whitespace
<color=#AB2800>s S</color>     First letter must be "s" or "S"
Please construct a regex that passes all test cases on the right.
